oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Use and efficiency of public support measures addressing organic farming
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Policy environments and social economy
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: For more than 20 years, organic farming has been a focus of politics. In the meantime numerous support programmes have been implemented at regional, national and European level. A comprehensive development and support strategy, coordinated with other relevant policy fields, is however lacking in many European countries. This is a key result of the study that provides a comprehensive overview of public support measures for organic farming in all 27 Member State and explores in-depth the relationship between policy measures, policy strategies and the development of organic farming.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Sanders, Jürn; Stolze, Matthias and Padel, Susanne (Eds.) (2011) Use and efficiency of public support measures addressing organic farming. Johann Heinrich von Thünen-Institut (vTI) - Federal Research Institute for Rural Areas, Forestry and Fisheries, Institute of Farm Economics, Braunschweig.
